channel.title: Latest alerts from washingtonpost.com
channel.description: An unofficial feed created by Derek Willis.

item.title: Judge orders release of 5-year-old detained by ICE in Minneapolis
item.description: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father were ordered released by a federal judge. The pair were detained in their driveway in Minnesota last week, sparking protests at the family detention center in Dilley, Texas, where they have been held.

item.title: Adding this much exercise to your daily routine may boost longevity
item.description: Using activity tracker data, researchers found that just a bit more exercise could save one in 10 people from an earlier death.

item.title: Judge won’t scale back Trump’s immigration surge in Minnesota for now
item.description: Minnesota officials had said the immigration crackdown was endangering public safety in their state.

item.title: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.
item.description: How many guesses will Keyword take you today? Try to beat the average now.

item.title: The ‘Melania’ documentary promises to take us behind the scenes. There’s nothing to see, our critic writes.
item.description: The new film about the elusive first lady mostly underscores her impenetrability.

item.title: Trump wants to build a 250-foot-tall arch, dwarfing the Lincoln Memorial
item.description: The president is eying a plot of land near Memorial Bridge. The art critic who proposed the idea called for a smaller arch or for Trump to pick a new site.

item.title: Senate passes funding deal, but short-term shutdown still expected
item.description: A temporary funding lapse will start Saturday before the House returns to consider the agreement early next week.

item.title: Catherine O’Hara dies at 71. The Canadian-born actress starred in ‘Schitt’s Creek’ and ‘Home Alone.’
item.description: O’Hara partnered with Christopher Guest for a series of beloved mockumentaries and gained a new generation of fans as a vain former soap-opera star on “Schitt’s Creek.”

item.title: Carolyn Hax chat: My husband is a liar and a thief. I don’t want to tell my family.
item.description: Carolyn Hax chat: My husband is a liar and a thief. I don’t want to tell my family.

item.title: Justice Department says it opened civil rights investigation into Alex Pretti’s shooting
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche’s announcement signals an apparent shift from its handling so far of shootings involving agents.

item.title: Luigi Mangione won’t face death penalty in case of UnitedHealthcare CEO’s killing
item.description: Mangione will not face the death penalty on charges of stalking and killing UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in late 2024, a federal judge ruled Friday.

item.title: Don Lemon arrested by federal officials over church protest
item.description: The former CNN host was taken into custody in Los Angeles.

item.title: Trump taps Fed critic Kevin Warsh to succeed Jerome Powell as chairman
item.description: The Wall Street veteran once held hawkish views on interest rates but has recently signaled a stance more in line with President Trump’s public demands.

item.title: Shutdown deadline. Anger in Minnesota. ICE warehouses. Tulsi Gabbard. ‘Melania’ premiere. Nor’easter. Slower aging. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Immigration agents wield an arsenal of powerful technology to track suspects — and protesters
item.description: Biometric trackers, cellphone location databases and drones are among the technologies that federal agents are tapping in their deportation campaign.

item.title: I’ve reported on UFO sightings for decades — and come to this conclusion
item.description: Aliens are sky gods for skeptics, deities for atheists and a secular alternative to replace the rapidly declining religiosity in the West.

item.title: Funding vote fails in Senate ahead of potential government shutdown
item.description: A procedural vote to advance a government funding package failed in the Senate, as Democratic leaders and the White House continue negotiations on measures to rein in the Department of Homeland Security after immigration officials killed Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

item.title: A nor’easter will bring snow and flooding. Here’s what to expect in your area this weekend.
item.description: Areas from the Southeast to New England will be hit by blizzard conditions, damaging winds, flooding and icy cold.

item.title: A documentary is the focus of today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Thursday points.

item.title: Trump administration plans to reduce immigration agent presence in Minnesota; senator says large-scale operations ended in Maine
item.description: President Donald Trump’s border czar, Tom Homan, said his team is working on a plan to draw down the number of federal immigration enforcement agents they have in Minneapolis, pending cooperation with state and local officials.

item.title: MAGA blowback. Shutdown deadline. Fulton County. Danish anger. Kennedy Center. More snow. Film registry. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Kennedy Center’s new programming head resigns days after his hire was announced
item.description: In a Jan. 16 news release, the Kennedy Center announced that Kevin Couch would be its new senior vice president of artistic programming. Less than two weeks later, he confirmed his resignation but declined to comment further.

item.title: Four symptoms of Parkinson’s disease that can show up decades before a diagnosis
item.description: Many people think of a tremor as the quintessential warning sign of the neurological disorder. But other symptoms — many of them not involving changes in movement — can appear much earlier.

item.title: D.C. Public Schools will open Thursday; some of the other schools in the area will remain closed
item.description: Officials have attributed the closures to lingering icy conditions on some roads and sidewalks as a bitter cold settles in the region.

item.title: Federal government moves to sell Old Post Office, once home to Trump International Hotel
item.description: Government officials are moving to sell the property to the bank that controls the long-term lease as “part of ongoing efforts to reduce the federal government’s footprint,” according to a letter sent to the city’s State Historic Preservation Office last month.

item.title: FBI executes search warrant seeking ballots from 2020 election in Georgia’s Fulton County
item.description: The actions mark the latest apparent move in President Donald Trump’s campaign to find widespread voter fraud from that election despite five years of debunked claims and dozens of dismissed court cases.

item.title: Two federal agents involved in Alex Pretti shooting placed on administrative leave
item.description: The development came a day after the Department of Homeland Security provided the first official timeline of the deadly encounter in a statement sent to some members of Congress.

item.title: Fed holds rates steady, signaling patience despite pressure from Trump
item.description: The decision marked the Fed’s first pause after cutting rates three times at the end of 2025, moves that officials and economists say were aimed at insulating the labor market as hiring slowed.

item.title: Greenland isn’t the answer to U.S. Arctic security. This place is.
item.description: The U.S. could start building a true Arctic fortress in Alaska tomorrow.

item.title: ‘My teen wrote a mean song about me’: Carolyn Hax readers give advice
item.description: ‘My teen wrote a mean song about me’: Carolyn Hax readers give advice

item.title: In the middle of a great meal, the manager told our group, ‘Time’s up’
item.description: In the middle of a great meal, the manager told our group, ‘Time’s up’

item.title: How Greg Bovino went from little-known head of a state Border Patrol office to the face of Trump’s immigration policy
item.description: Just months into President Donald Trump’s second term, Bovino emerged as a central figure in one of the most aggressive immigration crackdowns in U.S. history. Now that approach has turned into a political liability for the administration.

item.title: The 40th anniversary in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Wednesday points.

item.title: Ilhan Omar. Pretti killing. World Cup. Elon Musk. Bari Weiss. Parkinson’s symptoms. Snowfall map. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Rep. Ilhan Omar attacked during town hall meeting in Minneapolis but appeared unharmed and continued speaking
item.description: A man used a syringe to spray an unknown liquid at Omar, according to a police statement. He was immediately arrested and booked into jail on suspicion of 3rd degree assault, the statement added.

item.title: DHS report says two officers shot Alex Pretti, does not describe him brandishing gun
item.description: A preliminary review contradicts Trump administration comments in the immediate aftermath of the confrontation, when senior officials described the 37-year-old as a direct threat to federal officers.

item.title: FAA ignored warnings before ‘100 percent preventable’ DCA crash, federal investigators say
item.description: The deadly midair collision above Reagan National Airport that killed 67 people last January was due to systemic failures, said Jennifer Homendy, chair of the National Transportation Safety Board.

item.title: Without strategy shift, ‘we are toast,’ Bari Weiss says at staff meeting as she announces new contributors from her opinion site
item.description: Weiss, the editor in chief of CBS News, announced a new slate of network contributors — many of whom write for the Free Press, her conservative website. Weiss said she wanted the network to appeal to political moderates.

item.title: Judge rules Virginia Democrats violated law with redistricting amendment
item.description: The process Virginia Democrats used in an effort to create more blue-leaning congressional seats was invalid, a judge said. Democrats vowed to appeal. A referendum on the maps has been scheduled for April 21.

item.title: Five key moments in the Alex Pretti shooting that raise red flags for policing experts
item.description: The tactics U.S. Border Patrol agents used against Pretti in Minneapolis probably violate modern policing guidelines, several experts said, and add to a growing body of evidence that federal immigration officers are deviating from professional norms.

item.title: Trump aides declared these 16 DHS shootings justified before investigations were completed
item.description: Most of these incidents since July involved officers firing at drivers during enforcement stops in cities such as Los Angeles and Chicago where Department of Homeland Security has surged federal immigration officers. The shootings have sparked alarm not only for their violence but also for the Trump administration’s response.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: A high school bully is back decades later as friend’s new man
item.description: Carolyn Hax: A high school bully is back decades later as friend’s new man

item.title: Composer Philip Glass pulls world premiere from Kennedy Center
item.description: The pioneering composer said “the values of the Kennedy Center today are in direct conflict with the message” of his Symphony No. 15: “Lincoln,” slated to be performed in June by the National Symphony Orchestra.

item.title: What I discovered about Josh Shapiro at the Pennsylvania Farm Show
item.description: Gov. Josh Shapiro champions a 67-county strategy to win voters in a critical battleground state.

item.title: The world’s most expensive album in today’s On the Record
item.description: Answer now to earn your Tuesday points.

item.title: Minnesota chief federal judge orders the acting head of ICE to appear in court Friday, threatens contempt
item.description: U.S. District Judge Patrick J. Schiltz has demanded Acting ICE Director Todd M. Lyons explain what the judge described as repeated failures to comply with dozens of court orders amid its enforcement efforts in Minnesota.“ The court’s patience is at an end,” the judge wrote in a filing.

item.title: Minneapolis fallout. Park sign removals. Another storm. Gaza hostage. AI books. Kanye West apology. Toddler screens. Catch up now.
item.description: Catch up in minutes with these 7 stories.

item.title: Many D.C.-area schools and federal offices to remain closed Tuesday
item.description: The closures come as frigid temperatures are making it difficult to clean up after Sunday’s winter storm. The Office of Personnel Management said “maximum telework” would be in effect for federal workers.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Newlyweds disagree on response to brother’s theft of cash gifts
item.description: Carolyn Hax: Newlyweds disagree on response to brother’s theft of cash gifts

item.title: Trump’s tariffs can’t cover a bill this staggering. The Editorial Board ran the math.
item.description: Trump has promised to spend far more than what the tariff revenue could cover.
